author: yperbasis
content: Can fee burning exacerbate ETH price volatility? Consider this. When ETH is on the rise, there's likely more demand for transactions, more congestion, and more fee burning, leading to higher deflationary pressure, in turn leading to higher ETH prices. And vice versa, less fee burning and less deflationary pressure when ETH price is low.

author: fliguy.eth
content: L2's should reduce the congestion, just got to wait for the dApps to catch up, should be less traffic on the L1 eventually
